instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message:
hi... iam tryning repair a 820-00165 with water damage....i fix green orange light chande smc and J9500 with corrosion, now i have a nice green-orange in the charger....

ppbus_g3h.    8,59v
pp3v42_g3h.   3,42v
pp3v3_s5.    3,3v
pp5vs4rs3.  0.00v
pm_slp_s4_l  0.00 v no short to ground....when remove r7551 i have 5.100v in pp5vs4rs3 so u7501 is good
ppvrtc_g3h. 3.3 v
pp3v3_sus. 0,0 v. pm_slp_sus_l missing and not short to ground
to remove j9500 use air station below logicboard ..... that may be the cause

please help

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message:
What about PM_BATLOW_L and SMC_ADAPTER_EN?
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger.

Also check PCH's RTC signals.

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message:
ok same news.....i apply hot in pch with air station at 180º and flux amtech.......now fan spin chime and boot in to os
there is another problem in the logicboard... no keyboard and tradpad
i probe another good keyboard and flex cable and tradpad but nothing....any idea pleased

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message:
Looks like accumulated crap underneath CPU/PCH.

TP/KB work before macOS login?
Try to access boot menu...

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message: sometimes I can see the light of the shift keys before login ... I have even been able to type in the login but I have not been able to enter the boot menu by pressing the alt key...now it doesn't work anymore

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message:
TP talks with PCH in USB mode, before enters to macOS.
Once logged in, SPI mode is used.
So you must confirm if both ways bad, or not.
Access macOS with external keyboard and check.

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message: Although it seems incredible, I do not have a USB keyboard here now .... I am on vacation ... but I have used an arduino per USB configured as a keyboard ... and if the arduino writes in the login

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message: I have measured something in j4800 ... pin 2 tpad_spi_miso_r is 0.0 v .. this pin is output ... shouldn't it measure 3.3v?

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message:
ok correccion...
i get a usb keyboard. login in to os x with usb keyboard and TP/KB dont work
KB/TP dont work before and after login os x...dont work to enter boot menu

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message:
Check voltage on pins 1/19 of J4800.
Also post U4810 voltages, before and after entered OSX.

threads.title: 820-00165 water damage... missing pm_slp_s4_l
threads.message:
ok i fix the problem...there was two lines in u4810 with traces broken....pin 1,5,6   0.0v because traces broke.....fix it... now keyboards is working again
thamks you very much
